verb.description: Admit (a foreigner) to the citizenship of a country.
examples: he was born in a foreign country and had never been naturalized
synonyms: endow with the rights of citizenship

verb.description: Establish (a plant or animal) so that it lives wild in a region where it is not indigenous.
examples: by the 1920s, the species was naturalized in New England

verb.description: Alter (an adopted foreign word) so that it conforms more closely to the phonology or orthography of the adopting language.
examples: the stoccafisso of Liguria was naturalized in Nice as stocoficada

verb.description: Regard as or cause to appear natural.
examples: globalization has been naturalized as the inevitable pathway to economic prosperity and success

origin: Mid 16th century: from French naturaliser, from Old French natural (see natural).
